The Geneology of Books is a linked open data project with Eric Rochester. It emerged from a curiosity about the shape of personal reading habits: what books caused me to read other books, and how the books I’ve read helped develop thematic networks over time.The project takes an abstract model of linked open data and applies it to a web-based project on personal reading habits.
